meanings.definition: A place where something is protected or kept safe.
meanings.sent1: The protectories in the castle safeguarded the royal jewels.
meanings.sent2: The protectories in the bank vault ensured the security of the valuable documents.
meanings.sent3: The protectories in the zoo made sure the mischievous monkeys didn't escape.
meanings.sent4: Her arms were like protectories, shielding her little brother from harm.
meanings.sent5: The protectories of the ancient temple were said to be guarded by mystical spirits.

meanings.definition: The act of protecting or defending.
meanings.sent1: His brave protectories shielded the village from danger.
meanings.sent2: The protectories of the knights were praised for their loyalty and courage.
meanings.sent3: The protectories of the superhero costume were put to the test in the epic battle.
meanings.sent4: The protectories of the shield were unyielding against the enemy's attacks.
meanings.sent5: The protectories of the fortress stood strong against the invading army.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that protects or defends.
meanings.sent1: The loyal dog was a faithful protectories of the farm animals.
meanings.sent2: The brave soldier was known as a fearless protectories of his comrades.
meanings.sent3: The fluffy cat saw itself as the protectories of the household against mice.
meanings.sent4: The ancient sword was considered a legendary protectories of the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The wise owl was seen as a natural protectories of the forest creatures.
